programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: A young bull elephant is rescued after breaking his leg in a violent thunderstorm, and laser technology is used to save an elephant who has come into AandE with severe burns.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James performs surgery on a tiny zebra finch; Dr Lucinda attends to Froggie, the green tree frog who is actually blue; Dr Shane treats a Macquarie turtle whose abscess has burst through its shell.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: There is an enormous territory of plains in the north of South America that changes its appearance twice a year; we discover the capybara, gigantic anacondas, and the few remaining Orinoco crocodiles.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter heads to a local farm where Bernie the boar is strangely off his food, rescue dog Hector requires eye surgery, and Julians at Rodney Sheards farm to treat a couple of his rams.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes over to see worried cow farmer Joe, Peter heads to Richards farm - where a sheeps life is in danger - and at the Huddersfield hospital, Brandy the German Shepherd is lame and in pain.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Theres a shock in the borderlands where the Stork Colony pack roams, Vultures, elephants, baboons, and hyenas make for noisy neighbours for the Manzi pack, and the Kakuli pack goes missing.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: A young bull elephant is rescued after breaking his leg in a violent thunderstorm, and laser technology is used to save an elephant who has come into AandE with severe burns.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James performs surgery on a tiny zebra finch; Dr Lucinda attends to Froggie, the green tree frog who is actually blue; Dr Shane treats a Macquarie turtle whose abscess has burst through its shell.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: An emotional emergency for Peter at a friends farm; Steves wife is seriously ill, and now her favourite sheeps life is in the balance. Julian tries to remove an abscess on Karine the alpacas chin.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter faces a difficult calving at Ed McDonalds farm; can he get a baby out alive and save mum? Also, Julian faces one of his biggest ever challenges trying to treat one-ton Clydesdale horse Howard.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: Discover the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks, and join extreme kayakers and Patagonias cowboys - the gauchos - as they round up wild horses.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.title: Epic Animal Migrations: Patagonia
programme.desc: Each year sees thousands return to Patagonia to raise their young, many more come home to feed, and some to hunt - this is the story of their epic migrations.

programme.title: The View From On High
programme.desc: This documentary explores the intricacy, majesty, and ecological connections of our planet which can only be revealed by a birds-eye view.

programme.title: Wonders of Mexico
programme.sub-title: Mexico is a vast country; over 2,000 miles long, its dominated by a great chain of mountains known as the Sierra Madre. Journey down this rocky spine and youll discover an amazing diversity of life.
programme.desc: This documentary series reveals Mexicos astonishing wildlife, landscape and culture as we pay a visit to the ancient temples of the Maya, the Sierra Madre, and the Sonoran and Chihuahuan deserts.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi, the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs, and yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack and join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Program on a house call to the Kakumbi den where another pup has gone missing.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy Wade normally travels deep into the globes most remote regions searching for freshwater monsters, but recently hes been getting reports of killers from an unexpected location - the USA.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: This first episode features footage showing the lightning-fast moves that predators deploy to capture their prey and the rapid escape tactics that will see who wins these high-velocity battles.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.sub-title: Jeremy Wade normally travels deep into the globes most remote regions searching for freshwater monsters, but recently hes been getting reports of killers from an unexpected location - the USA.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Natures Fast Attacks
programme.sub-title: This first episode features footage showing the lightning-fast moves that predators deploy to capture their prey and the rapid escape tactics that will see who wins these high-velocity battles.
programme.desc: In this two-part documentary series, we see footage that captures the lightning-fast moves used to ambush prey and make equally rapid escapes in the terrifying moments between life and death.

programme.title: Animals Decoded
programme.sub-title: The knowledge passed down in some species can evolve in response to changes in their natural environment; could the flexibility of their cultures be the key to their survival in changing environments?
programme.desc: There is a whole world of animal languages waiting to be decoded; this series shares the latest science and fascinating footage of animals in the wild to reveal the secrets of animal communication.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: This episode introduces lions with distinct personalities and follows them as they hunt and explore new territories, but conflict arises when the mothers return with new cubs.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Oloborr emerges as the leader of a pride which mainly relies on buffalo for food; as it faces obstacles in establishing dominance, tensions arise within the group.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are attempting to rehabilitate a mentally ill young bull in the hospitals male herd, Kat gets her hands dirty with elephant poo, and Paul helps the vets treat an infected abscess.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr Hamish treats a bitey ferret called Nibbler, Dr James does a health check on Zeus the black-headed python, and Dr Michelle treats a talkative eclectus parrot with suspected reproductive problems.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The Caribbean Sea is a mythical place with a wild jungle world living on its shores; this region is home to the axolotls, the Montezuma oropendola, dozens of species of tree frogs, and pit vipers.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes over to see worried cow farmer Joe, Peter heads to Richards farm - where a sheeps life is in danger - and at the Huddersfield hospital, Brandy the German Shepherd is lame and in pain.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Surviving the Asteroid
programme.desc: 66 million years ago: a gigantic asteroid hits the Earth and wipes out the reign of the dinosaurs as no animal weighing more than 500 grams survives this catastrophe. Who are the survivors?

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: Titanosaurs are the largest animals ever to walk the Earth; palaeontologists explore their gigantic fossils to discover why they grew so big.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: A team in South America uncover the bones of a rare armoured dinosaur; could it be a missing link in the evolution of the ankylosaurs?
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Giants
programme.sub-title: Dan ONeill is on a mission to find, film and measure the planets biggest predatory sharks; he heads to the Neptune Islands, a place that is perfect for spotting giant great whites.
programme.desc: Explorer, biologist and conservationist Dan ONeill is on the trail of the largest living animals in the world; what does it take to become and survive as a giant past or present?

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda rescues a blind pet baboon and Dr Charlotte operates on a pangolin whose leg must be amputated; two young baboons have gone AWOL, and we encounter a feisty monitor lizard.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: A puppy fights against a deadly disease in the Karratha Vet Hospital, a chicken gets a prosthetic leg, and Dr Lu volunteers in a koala crisis caused by bushfires on Kangaroo Island.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: A large part of the jungle that covers Central and South America is known as the rainforest; it is home to howler monkeys, jaguars, iguanas, bush dogs and king vultures.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.
